tool.name: tool_2

param.name: OUTPUT
param.dialogReference:
Output

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] kml and image files

[1] kmz, kml and image files

[2] kmz file

Default: 2

param.name: COLOURING
param.dialogReference:
Colouring

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] stretch to grid's standard deviation

[1] stretch to grid's value range

[2] stretch to specified value range

[3] lookup table

[4] rgb coded values

Default: 0

param.name: COL_PALETTE
param.dialogReference:
Color Palette

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] DEFAULT

[1] DEFAULT_BRIGHT

[2] BLACK_WHITE

[3] BLACK_RED

[4] BLACK_GREEN

[5] BLACK_BLUE

[6] WHITE_RED

[7] WHITE_GREEN

[8] WHITE_BLUE

[9] YELLOW_RED

[10] YELLOW_GREEN

[11] YELLOW_BLUE

[12] RED_GREEN

[13] RED_BLUE

[14] GREEN_BLUE

[15] RED_GREY_BLUE

[16] RED_GREY_GREEN

[17] GREEN_GREY_BLUE

[18] RED_GREEN_BLUE

[19] RED_BLUE_GREEN

[20] GREEN_RED_BLUE

[21] RAINBOW

[22] NEON

[23] TOPOGRAPHY

[24] ASPECT_1

[25] ASPECT_2

[26] ASPECT_3

Default: 0

param.name: LUT
param.dialogReference:
Lookup Table

Static table

5 Fields:

- 1. [color] Color

- 2. [string] Name

- 3. [string] Description

- 4. [8 byte floating point number] Minimum

- 5. [8 byte floating point number] Maximum

param.name: RESAMPLING
param.dialogReference:
Interpolation

Boolean

Default: 1

Resampling method used when projection is needed

param.name: SHADE_BRIGHT_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Maximum: 100.000000

Default: 0.000000

Allows one to scale shade brightness [percent]

param.name: SHADE_BRIGHT_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Maximum: 100.000000

Default: 100.000000

Allows one to scale shade brightness [percent]

tool.summary: Uses 'Export Image' tool to create the image file. Automatically projects raster to geographic coordinate system, if its projection is known and not geographic.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
